citeinfo.origin: US Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Water
citeinfo.title: EPA Office of Water (OW): TMDLs on Impaired Waters NHDPlus Indexed Dataset

descript.abstract: The Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) Tracking System contains information on waters that are Not Supporting their designated uses. These waters are listed by the state as impaired under Section 303(d) of the Clean Water Act. The status of TMDLs are also tracked. TMDLs are pollution control measures that reduce the discharge of pollutants into impaired waters. A TMDL or Total Maximum Daily Load is a calculation of the maximum amount of a pollutant that a waterbody can receive and still meet water quality standards, and an allocation of that amount to the pollutant's sources. What is a total maximum daily load (TMDL)? Water quality standards are set by States, Territories, and Tribes. They identify the uses for each waterbody, for example, drinking water supply, contact recreation (swimming), and aquatic life support (fishing), and the scientific criteria to support that use. A TMDL is the sum of the allowable loads of a single pollutant from all contributing point and nonpoint sources. The calculation must include a margin of safety to ensure that the waterbody can be used for the purposes the state has designated. The calculation must also account for seasonal variation in water quality. The Clean Water Act, section 303, establishes the water quality standards and TMDL programs.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this application is to provide a summary of the TMDL program that are available for EPA Regions and the states. There are a few ways to access these reports. Go to http://www.epa.gov/waters/tmdl to access the tools that provide the TMDL reports for the nation, state, or region.
descript.supplinf: This is an EPA-produced data set. Additional information regarding this data set is available at http://water.epa.gov/lawsregs/lawsguidance/cwa/tmdl/index.cfm

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currentness and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness.

horizpa.horizpar: See NHDPlus documentation for information on positional accuracy.

vertacc.vertaccr: See NHDPlus documentation for information on positional accuracy.

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (USEPA) and the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS).
citeinfo.title: National Hydrography Dataset Plus - NHDPlus

srcinfo.srccontr: NHDPlus v2.1 is the source of all reached indexed events in the EPA Reach Address Database.

procstep.procdesc: 303D event data extracted from RAD archive per list of source featureids provided by ATTAINS Program.
303D event data restructured and published as TMDL event data.

attr.attrdef: 40-char GUID value that uniquely identifies the occurrence of each event.

attrdomv.udom: 40-byte Global Universal Unique Identifier

attr.attrdef: The date the event was created or updated.

attrdomv.udom: Date value

attr.attrdef: Unique identifier composed of two parts. The first eight digits are the subbasin code defines by FIPS 103, next six digits is a randomly assigned sequential number unique within a Cataloging Unit, length 14.

attr.attrdef: Percentage of the feature contained within the WBD12 unit

For reached area events, this value is the coefficient of areal correspondence between the event geometry and its parent NHD reach geometry. A value of 1 indicates the area event geometry is equal to the parent reach geometry. The majority of area events in the RAD are equal to the entire parent reach.

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the Environmental Protection Agency, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. It is strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data to evaluate data set limitations, restrictions or intended use. The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.

digtinfo.formcont: These spatial files represent the most up-to-date publicly available Water program data by State or arbitrary region from the Reach Address Database (RAD).

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
